title-group.article-title: ‘You Became Someone’ Social Hierarchies in Girls’ Communities at Riding Stables

contrib-group.aff: University of Helsinki, Department of Philosophy, History, Culture and Art Studies, Finland

fn.p: Karoliina Ojanen (PhD) is a Researcher in the Department of Philosophy, History, Culture and Art Studies at the University of Helsinki. [email: karoliina.ojanen@helsinki.fi]

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2012 SAGE Publications and Young Editorial Board
permissions.copyright-holder: SAGE Publications and Young Editorial Board

abstract.p: The riding stable has become an important social sphere for girls in the Nordic countries. In this article I concentrate on the hierarchy and the use of social power in girls’ communities at Finnish horseback riding stables. I also contemplate how horses and taking care of them are intertwined in girls’ social practices. I illustrate how they affect the construction of girl’s agency and the communal agency as a whole and the positions that girls hold and produce in the hierarchy. This article discusses in which different ways girls construct their intimate hierarchies in these unique communities.
